Sentencas: Hermetic gas seals are critical components of planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: This article focuses on the comparative evaluation of a glass-ceramic seal developed by the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) and a self-healing glass seal developed by the University of Cincinnati.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: The stress and strain levels in the Positive electrode-Electrolyte-Negative electrode (PEN) seal in a single-cell stack are evaluated using a multi-physics simulation package developed at PNNL Simulations were carried out with and without consideration of a clamping force and a stack body force, respectively.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: The results indicate that the overall stress and strain levels are dominated by the thermal expansion mismatches between the different cell components.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: Further, compared with the glass-ceramic, the self-healing glass results in a much lower steady state stress value due to its much lower stiffness at the operating temperature of the SOFC.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: It also exhibits much shorter relaxation times due to a high creep rate.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: It is also noted that the self-healing glass seal will experience continuing creep deformation at the operating temperature of a SOFC therefore resulting in possible overflow of the sealant material.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures

Sentencas: Therefore, a stopper material may be required to maintain its geometric stability during operation.
Titulo: A modeling study on the thermomechanical behavior of glass-ceramic and self-healing glass seals at elevated temperatures
